segments.text: I can hardly make ends meet these days .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: same here . I have't brought any new clothes for three months .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: my income remains the same but prices just continue to rise .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: true . The news says that there is a general increase in the price of daily necessities .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: definitely . I have to spend 300 yuan more on food every month .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: the biggest price jump is for pork , so most people have to turn to chicken .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: inflation is more than just the rising prices , I guess . But the central bank is warning about the risk of inflation .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: has the government taken some measures to curb it ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: yes . The government has banned price hikes in some key industries like energy .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: but I'm afraid the price hikes will spill over from food into other areas of the economy .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: you said it . I think we should tighten our budget and cut our spending .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: for a start , we can take the public transport to work . You know , running a car is a big expense .
segments.speaker: S1
